Package org.upmc.electisim

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    IAgentGenerator
    An interface for the different agent generators.
    IAgentStrategy
    An interface for the agent strategies.
    IBestResponseAgentStrategy  
    IBetterResponseAgentStrategy  
    ICandidateGenerator
    An interface for the candidate generators.
    IElectable
    An interface for the electable entities of the application.
    ILearningAgentStrategy  
    IPreferencesCompleter  
    IPreferencesGenerator
    An interface for the preferences generator.
    IVotingRule
    The interface that every voting rule in the application must implement.
    SimulationEngine.ResultListener
    The type used for the even listener called when a result is produced (after each step of the simulation)
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Agent
    A class representing an agent, also referred to as a voter in the application.
    AgentVote
    A class representing the vote of a single agent after applying the voting strategy.
    App
    The main class of the application.
    ARankingAgentStrategy
    A strategy class used to restrict the knowledge to a simple ranking of the candidates.
    AStatefulAgentStrategy
    A strategy class used to restrict the knowledge to a stateful knowledge of the situation.
    BlocVotingRule
    A class implementing the K-approval voting rule, one of the simplest voting rules found in the literature.
    BordaVotingRule
    A class implementing the k-Borda voting rule, a very common voting rule in the literature.
    Candidate
    A class representing a Candidate, one of the electable entities.
    ChamberlinCourantVotingRule
    A class implementing the Chamberlin-Courant voting rule.
    Committee
    An electable entity representing a committee.
    ElectionResult
    A class representing the result of an election, containing the score map and the elected committee.
    IncrementalPreferencesCompleter
    Incrementally complete the preferences of an agent WARNING : Defunkt.
    OmniscientBestResponseStrategy
    A voting strategy with total knowledge in the class of best responses strategies, meaning that this strategy doesn't use heuristics and instead will find the absolute best answer to the voting problem assuming that the agents vote in isolation and hence to not communicate.
    Preferences
    The preferences of an agent in the simulation.
    PreferencesValidator
    A class used to validate the preferences of a candidate and check if they're consistant with the current simulation configuration.
    RandomPreferencesGenerator
    A random preferences generator which will used a simple shuffle on the candidate list to generate the preferences.
    SimpleAgentGenerator
    A simple agent generator, incrementing a simple counter to generate unique names for agents.
    SimpleCandidateGenerator
    A simple candidate generator, incrementing a simple counter to generate unique names for the candidates.
    SimulationEngine
    The simulation engine, used to manage the simulation execution.
    SimulationProfile
    A class used to aggregate the necessary information about the simulation, thus creating a profile.
    SimulationState
    A class representing a state of the simulation.
    StateBuffer
    The buffer containing all the states of the simulation.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    PreferenceType
    An enumeration type used to indicate the type of an agent's preferences
    SimulationExecutionState
    An enumeration used to represent the execution state of the simulation.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    GenericMessageException
    A class of exception which take a message at construction, which can be then used when the user wants to retrieve informations.
    InvalidStateSteppingException
    An exception class thrown when an invalid stepping operation occurs
    ListenerNotFoundException
    An exception which might be thrown when a listener is not found but requested for.
    PreferencesInconsistencyException
    An exception class used when the preferences of an agent are inconsistent.
